mdxSource.renderedOutput:
An interactive museum inside legendary supersonic aircraft. This project is a flying simulator with physical control elements (steering wheel, pedals, tumblers, arrows, etc.) and dynamic suspension seat. Aircraft control panel is emulated with 8 mini displays.

Responsibilities: gameplay and scenario logic, flying physics, sound, sampling input from physical controls, sending data back (for highlighting control elements with diodes), controlling seat suspension. TCP client/server for aircraft control panel data synchronization.

Technologies: Unity, C#, FMOD

frontMatter.title: Tu-144
frontMatter.summary: An interactive museum inside legendary supersonic aircraft.

next.summary: Unity has great asset management system in a form of Addressables, but to properly leverage all its functionality there is a need for a robust wrapper that carefully handles all operations with proper exceptions reporting and resources cleanup. Here is my reasoning behind creating that kind of wrapper.
